hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid regarding the saying of Allah: 'Indeed for the righteous is success' (Surah an-Naba 31): He said that success means they have saved themselves from the Fire.

narrators.name: Abd al-Rahman
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn al-Husayn ibn Muhammad ibn Ja'far al-Shibaani
narrators.alternative_names: Muhammad ibn al-Husayn al-Shibaani, Abu al-Fath al-Shibaani

narrators.name: Ibrahim
narrators.full_name: Ibrahim ibn Fahd ibn Hakim ibn Ibrahim ibn Qudamah ibn Mahan al-Basri
narrators.alternative_names: Ibrahim ibn Fahd al-Basri, Abu Ishaq al-Saji

narrators.name: Warqa
narrators.full_name: Warqa ibn Uthman (possibly ibn Abi Said al-Mu'alli)

narrators.name: Ibn Abi Najih
narrators.full_name: Shafi ibn Mati' al-Asbuhi (or Shafi ibn Abdullah al-Masri)
reliabilityIssues: Uses indirect transmission term with known mudallis
narrators.alternative_names: Shafi ibn Mati' al-Asbuhi, Shafi ibn Abdullah al-Masri

chainIssues: Chain uses 'عَنِ' (from) with Ibn Abi Najih who is classified as mudallis category 3, which creates ambiguity in transmission
Multiple obscure narrators (Abd al-Rahman, Ibrahim, Adam) with limited biographical data
Chain ends with interpretation (maqtu'), not attributed to Prophet ﷺ or Companion
Ibn Abi Najih is known as weak narrator (Da'if)

potential_issues.issue: Ibn Abi Najih is classified as a mudallis (category 3) and uses indirect transmission term 'عَنِ'
potential_issues.impact: Creates significant ambiguity in the chain as mudallis using indirect terms cannot be relied upon without knowing if they directly heard from the narrator

potential_issues.issue: Multiple narrators in the chain (Abd al-Rahman, Ibrahim, Adam) lack clear biographical identification
potential_issues.impact: Makes it impossible to determine if these narrators were reliable or if they met their teachers

potential_issues.issue: Ibn Abi Najih is classified as weak (Da'if) by hadith scholars
potential_issues.impact: Weakens the reliability of the entire chain significantly

potential_issues.issue: Tafsir commentary - not a hadith from Prophet ﷺ but rather scholarly interpretation
potential_issues.impact: The hadith is maqtu' (broken chain at the level of tafsir scholar), ending at Mujahid's interpretation

Topics: Interpretation of Qur'an - Surah an-Naba verse 31
Definition of success for the righteous
Escape from the Fire

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Abbas: The Ruh (angels/spirits) are a command from the commands of Allah, creation from the creation of Allah. He has shaped them in the form of the children of Adam. No angel descends from the heaven except with one of the Ruh.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated regarding the saying of Allah: 'The day when a man sees what he has sent forward' (Surah an-Naba 40): It is said that the believer is the prudent one who was cautious, knowing that he has a Return, so he would advance and advance. When he came before his Lord, he looked at what he had advanced and was pleased. And the disbeliever says: 'Oh, if only I were dust' because he does not advance any good, so he says: 'Oh, if only I were dust, then he would not become dust.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Mujahid regarding the saying of Allah: 'The day when the quake will tremble' (Surah an-Naziat 6): He said that the earth and mountains will quake, and it is the earthquake. 'Followed by the next quake' (verse 7): He said that they will be struck in a single strike.
